document_title: Eclampsia: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_name: san-giat.json_2_Symptoms of postpartum eclampsia are common
subsection_content:
MSc. Dinh Thi Hien Le said that because it is the cause of eclampsia, pregnant women may experience signs of pre-eclampsia such as:
High blood pressure;; Swelling (edema), especially in the face, hands, and feet;; Headache;; Uncontrolled weight gain;; Nausea, vomiting, vomiting;; Abdominal pain, especially in the upper right abdomen;; Difficulty in urination;; Vision problems such as blurred vision and loss of vision.
However, M.D. Dinh Thi Hien Le emphasized, "Sick pregnant women may have the above symptoms, but there are also cases where pregnant women do not experience any symptoms but immediately experience dangerous symptoms of diseases such as convulsions, deep coma, gradual loss of consciousness. Therefore, it is recommended that pregnant women have regular prenatal check-ups as prescribed by their doctors, early screening for disease risks, and preventing dangerous pregnancy complications from occurring."
Pregnant women with the disease may have early symptoms of preeclampsia
